page.title: 14A visit to Mrs Hodges
page.content: Mrs Hodges is in her 80s. She used to knit for the Stonehenge Knitting Co. She stopped because it was very poorly paid. The firm wanted the items knitted so quickly she had no time for her family. She was knitting special jumpers for the relief work in Ethiopia. They were of a special pattern with short sleeves and a longer than normal body. This is because the starving children also need protection from the extremely cold nights they have to endure. To date she has knitted 32 jumpers for Oxfam. She still knits complicated patterns on Arran design jumpers for friends and relations. She learnt to knit using two sticks and a bit of string. At school she was always in demand in knitting lessons because she was the only one who could pick up the dropped stitches.
